title: Introduction to PxWebApiData
text: introduction R-package PxWebApiData given . Six calls main function, ApiData, demonstrated. First, two calls reading data sets shown. third call captures meta data. However, practise, one may look meta data first. three examples background given. Note: Earlier versions vignette demonstrated “readymade datasets GetApiData”. Statistics Norway remove readymade API 2025, examples now replaced. new PxWebApi 2 now primary API Statistics Norway. See section “PxWebApi 2 examples GetApiData” .

what: Specification by variable indices and variable id’s
title: Introduction to PxWebApiData
text: dataset three variables, Region, ContentsCode Tid. variables can used input parameters. two parameters specified variable id’s one parameter specified indices. Negative values used specify reversed indices. Thus, obtain two first two last years data. list two data frames returned; label version id version. return single dataset labels use function ApiData1. function Apidata2 returns id’s. return dataset labels id’s one dataframe use ApiData12.

title: Introduction to PxWebApiData
text: PxWebApi offers two filters groupings, agg: vs:. can see filters code “API Query table” made table PxWeb. agg: used readymade aggregation groupings. example shows use aggregation age groups aggregated timeseries new Norwegian municipality structure 2020. Also note url /en replaced /. returns labels Norwegian instead English. two limitations PxWebApi using filters. name filter id’s shown metadata, code “API Query table”. filters agg: vs: can take single elements input. Filter "":"*" eg. TRUE, work agg: vs:. filter vs:, specify grouping value sets, part value pool. possible give single elements input, easier query value pool. means vs: redundant. example Region value pool Fylker (counties) value set. vs:Fylker redundant, return :

title: Introduction to PxWebApiData
text: Statistics Norway announced PxWebApi 2 now primary API Statbank Norway’s 7500 public tables. API supports GET queries defined entirely URL. Version 1 PxWebApi continue exist parallel period time, supports POST queries. limited API “readymade datasets” removed 2025, since PxWebApi 2 offers GET queries. GetApiData function can used URLs PxWebApi 2 similar way previously used “readymade datasets”. corresponds using parameter getDataByGET = TRUE ApiData function. Corresponding wrapper functions GetApiData1, GetApiData2 GetApiData12 available ApiData1, ApiData2 ApiData12.
code: # Example dataset url1 <- "https://data.ssb.no/api/pxwebapi/v2/tables/05810/data?lang=en" x <- GetApiData(url1) Not available - 429 x[[1]]    # Label version of the dataset NULL comment(x) Warning in max(nchar(com)): no non-missing arguments to max; returning -Inf # More specific query with selected dimensions url2 <- paste0(   "https://data.ssb.no/api/pxwebapi/v2/tables/03013/data?lang=en",   "&valueCodes[Konsumgrp]=??",   "&valueCodes[ContentsCode]=KpiIndMnd",   "&valueCodes[Tid]=top(2)" )  x2 <- GetApiData2(url2) Not available - 429 x2  # id version of the dataset NULL

title: PX-Web Data by API — ApiData
text: function read PX-Web data R via API. example code reads data three national statistical institutes, Statistics Norway, Statistics Sweden Statistics Finland.

title: PX-Web Data by API — ApiData
code: ApiData(   urlToData,   ...,   getDataByGET = FALSE,   returnMetaData = FALSE,   returnMetaValues = FALSE,   returnMetaFrames = FALSE,   returnApiQuery = FALSE,   defaultJSONquery = c(1, -2, -1),   verbosePrint = FALSE,   use_factors = FALSE,   urlType = "SSB",   apiPackage = "httr",   dataPackage = "rjstat",   returnDataSet = NULL,   makeNAstatus = TRUE,   responseFormat = "json-stat2" )  GetApiData(..., getDataByGET = TRUE)  pxwebData(..., apiPackage = "pxweb", dataPackage = "pxweb")  PxData(..., apiPackage = "pxweb", dataPackage = "rjstat")  ApiData1(..., returnDataSet = 1)  ApiData2(..., returnDataSet = 2)  ApiData12(..., returnDataSet = 12)  GetApiData1(..., returnDataSet = 1)  GetApiData2(..., returnDataSet = 2)  GetApiData12(..., returnDataSet = 12)  pxwebData1(..., returnDataSet = 1)  pxwebData2(..., returnDataSet = 2)  pxwebData12(..., returnDataSet = 12)  PxData1(..., returnDataSet = 1)  PxData2(..., returnDataSet = 2)  PxData12(..., returnDataSet = 12)

title: PX-Web Data by API — ApiData
text: urlToData url data id SSB data ... specification JSON query variable getDataByGET TRUE, readymade dataset GET returnMetaData TRUE, metadata returned returnMetaValues TRUE, values metadata returned returnMetaFrames TRUE, values valueTexts metadata returned data frames returnApiQuery TRUE, JSON query returned defaultJSONquery specification variables included ... verbosePrint TRUE, printing console use_factors Parameter fromJSONstat defining whether dimension categories factors character objects. urlType Parameter defining url constructed id number. Currently two Statistics Norway possibilities: "SSB" (Norwegian) "SSBen" (English) apiPackage Package used capture json(-stat) data API: "httr" (default) "pxweb" dataPackage Package used transform json(-stat) data data frame: "rjstat" (default) "pxweb" returnDataSet Possible non-NULL values 1, 2 12. single data set returned data frame. 1: first data set 2: second data set 12: data sets combined makeNAstatus TRUE dataPackage "rjstat" missing entries value, function tries add additional variable, named NAstatus, status codes. responseFormat Response format used apiPackage dataPackage defaults  ("json-stat" "json-stat2").

title: PX-Web Data by API — ApiData
text: list two data sets (label id)

title: PX-Web Data by API — ApiData
text: variable specified using variable name input parameter. value can specified : TRUE (), FALSE (eliminated), imaginary value (top), variable indices, original variable id's (values) variable labels (valueTexts). Reversed indices can specified negative values. Indices outside range removed. Variables specified set value defaultJSONquery whose default means first two last elements. value can also specified (unnamed) two-element list corresponding two query elements, filter values. addition possible single-element list. filter set ''. See examples. comment attribute elements label, source updated added output named character vector. available, elements tableid contents also included, resulting vector 3 5 elements. Run comment obtain information. Functionality package pxweb can utilized making use parameters apiPackage dataPackage implemented wrappers PxData pxwebData. data sets large ordinary downloads, PxData can solve problem (multiple downloads). using pxwebData, data downloaded px-json format instead json-stat output data frame organized differently (ContentsCode categories separate variables).
